name: vacillation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the lack of ability to decide what to do, or the act of changing often between two opinions: The confusion about the project has been made worse by the vacillation and indecision. There were some doubts and vacillations on this issue within the party. See
vacillate
More examplesFewer examplesShe accused him of vacillation and weakness.They were annoyed by the apparent vacillation of the monarchs in responding to their demands.She implicitly criticized him for his alleged vacillation on security issues.
